top_comments.comment:
Thank you so much, Brett and Eddy, to create this amazing list, many of the pieces in it was still unknown for me before I watch this video. 
Anyways, I have had a list of pieces which I hope more people should know about before I watch this. Here is the list: 
1. Ravel - Introduction et Allegro pour Harp, Flûte, Clarinette et Quatuor à Cordes
2. Ravel - 3 Poèmes de Stéphane Mallarmé
3. Ravel - La Valse
4. Ravel - Piano Trio
5. Brahms - Piano Quintet 
6. Brahms - Piano Sonata no. 3
7. Rachmaninoff - Cello Sonata
8. Scriabin - Piano Sonata no. 5
9. Scriabin - Prelude no. 1
10. Debussy - Estampes
What do you guys think abt this list???

Thanks for your vids. You have brought an extra dimension to my life. 
I was at home listening to Dvořák for the first time yesterday. Now I have some more new pieces to explore. Cheers

comments_since_last_sample.body: That Britten piece makes me think of the Twilight Zone and other anthology shows of that time.

Prokofiev Piano Concerto 3 underrated? Everyone plays it. 
Piano Concerto 2 is underrated.

Thank you so much, Brett and Eddy, to create this amazing list, many of the pieces in it was still unknown for me before I watch this video. 
Anyways, I have had a list of pieces which I hope more people should know about before I watch this. Here is the list: 
1. Ravel - Introduction et Allegro pour Harp, Flûte, Clarinette et Quatuor à Cordes
2. Ravel - 3 Poèmes de Stéphane Mallarmé
3. Ravel - La Valse
4. Ravel - Piano Trio
5. Brahms - Piano Quintet 
6. Brahms - Piano Sonata no. 3
7. Rachmaninoff - Cello Sonata
8. Scriabin - Piano Sonata no. 5
9. Scriabin - Prelude no. 1
10. Debussy - Estampes
What do you guys think abt this list???
You guys should both make playlists of the pieces that you listen to the most. I would listen to them both literally all of the time.

Mahler 7th is the best... 😉

Parry: wonderful music. Lots of fun to sing.
I wonder if Sibelius named Le Sapin in French or Swedsh (or both?), because you'll see both online

Yet more underrated pieces...
Piano solo: Bartok, 6 Dances on Bulgarian rhythms -- Brahms, Scherzo
Organ solo: Howells, Rhapsody No. 3 in C sharp -- Widor, Symphony No. 3 in E minor
Chamber music: Beethoven, Trio Op. 70 No. 1 "Ghost"
Concertos: Mendelssohn, violin+piano+orchestra in D minor -- Pietro Yon, Concerto Gregoriano
Symphonies: Alfven, No. 2 in D (Be warned, the first movement can be very deceptive with regard to the overall character...) -- Vaughan Williams, No. 3 "Pastoral"
Choral: Havergal Brian, Symphony No. 1 "Gothic"
Im gonna ask the real qn , "Which one was recommended by editor san?"
